metadata.title: CVE-2022-26495 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In nbd-server in nbd before 3.24, there is an integer overflow with aresultant heap-based buffer overflow. A value of 0xffffffff in the namelength field will cause a zero-sized buffer to be allocated for the name,resulting in a write to a dangling pointer. This issue exists for theNBD_OPT_INFO, NBD_OPT_GO, and NBD_OPT_EXPORT_NAME messages.

criterions.comment: nbd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
